description: 1835–45, Americanism; hoe +‎ down. Social gathering after work time has finished

entries.meaning: A type of American folk or square dance.
examples: John and Susie went to the square dance and did the hoedown.

entries.meaning: The type of music typically played for such a dance
A gathering at which such dances take place.
examples: We have to get to the hoedown before noon, or we'll be late.

verbs.description: hoedown (third-person singular simple present hoedowns, present participle hoedowning, simple past and past participle hoedowned)

examples: Having spent the day in the company of this thoughtful, friendly, uncommonly levelheaded band – charmed, completely – a protective part of me sort of wishes they wouldn't hoedown
